title: New: Neon Jung – Delirium Tremens (Nathan Fake Remix)
content:
This year will be a big year for Nottingham’s Lone, I trust.

His label Magic Wire has previously released a promising single from his colleague Neon Jung – a friend I presume, previously known as Keaver & Brause and one time working with Lone as Kona Triangle. All projects I’ve mentioned are worth checking out if you haven’t already.

Anyway, Lone mentioned a release of both his next album (entitled Galaxy Garden) and Neon Jung‘s next single, featuring a remix from James Holden‘s Border Community regular Nathan Fake. I assume the single’s coming soon because the remix has just been posted by Fake, and it’s brilliant – a long one, usual for the Norfolk producer, but also returning to previous greatness (2009’s Hard Islands was his career highlight so far), and leapfrogging off last years Radiohead remix success. Plenty of ambience and a solid techno beat makes this one another surefire winner. It just needs to be heard to be believed…

Enjoy Nathan Fake’s remix of Delirium Tremens below. The single is out mid-February on 12″ via Magic Wire Recordings.
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d10
